channel.title: Hammer problem
channel.description:
hey guys,
not sure if this has been posted, im having a glitch with hammer
i just made a train using brushes (and custom textures if it helps), i made it into a func_tracktrain, but when i run the map, a random brush appears in the middle of the train, it doesnt collide but its visible, and i cant see it in the hammer grid
any help?

item.title: Hammer problem
item.dc:creator: Spycrabz
item.description:
havnt checked this thread in ages, i tried all these suggestions to no avail, so i started making the tracktrain again, it was just a once-off thing, thanks anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Hammer problem
item.dc:creator: Mangled
item.description:
Didn’t accidentally parent a random brush to the train by mis-clicking did you?

Try selecting your whole map change all entities to world and then turn your train back into func_tracktrain.

Screenshots would be helpful. Also there’s no point using tracktrain without a track…

Read full topic

item.title: Hammer problem
item.dc:creator: xWhiteDarkness
item.description:
You need to create 2 path_corners (or path_track if you want, I like the corner one more). IN THE CENTER of your train. Try to navigate with the 2D views to get the path_corner in the precise middle of your train. Now create another path_corner, at another point (and so on). Select the first path_corner and press ALT+ENTER. Name it Track_1 and next stop target Track_2. Go to the second path_corner and do the same thing but name it Track_2
Now go to the train and press ALT+ENTER, name it something (if you want a button to activate it) and choose First Stop Target to Track_1

Should work now. You can ask me any question about Hammer, quite good experience with it.

Read full topic

ok, ill try that later, im using the orange box sdk with half life 2 - episode 2

item.title: Hammer problem
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Press F5 ingame, then look in your game directory. (Eg, C:/Program files/Half-life if that’s where you installed HL)
Which engine, What version of hammer?

Read full topic
